definition: to enter the emperor's palace/(slang) to go to jail
to go forward/to advance/to go in/to enter/to put in/to submit/to take in/to admit/(math.) base of a number system/classifier for sections in a building or residential compound
palace/temple/castration (as corporal punishment)/first note in pentatonic scale
name of a famous opera/(slang) to go to jail for a second offense
(slang) to have served several sentences/recidivist/old lag

sentences.english: Therefore, he immediately sent for a farmer into his palace.
sentences.chinese: 於是，他馬上命人找一個農夫進宮。

sentences.english: Wangchuyi should have more of the Sejong taught at the invitation of the palace Road school.
sentences.chinese: 王處一更曾應金世宗的邀請進宮講授道學。

sentences.english: The cavaliers rushed into the palace to protect the king.
sentences.chinese: 武士們衝進宮裏保護國王。
他走進宮去，兩眼噙滿了淚水。

sentences.english: Came to the palace, the door guard did not recognize Zhu Yunwen, let him into the house.
sentences.chinese: 來到宮門，門口守衛卻不認識朱允文，不讓他進宮。

sentences.english: You think I desire to go for this purpose?
sentences.chinese: 你以爲我很想爲了這個進宮？

sentences.english: I was also 14, when Emperor Taizong called for me. How did you enter the palace?
sentences.chinese: 太宗皇帝召我進宮時，我也十四歲。你是怎麼進的宮？

sentences.english: He has been repeatedly jailed and then released, each time going immediately to a restaurant and ordering lavishly.
sentences.chinese: 約翰遜幾度進宮，每次釋放都要立即去飯店飽餐一頓。

sentences.english: At this time, the house XuanZhi send someone to pick up LeEr palace.
sentences.chinese: 這時，宮裏派人宣旨要接樂兒進宮。

sentences.english: I said to my friends as theyhappily went in with me.
sentences.chinese: 我向戰友們說，於是大家都開心地跟着我進宮去了。

sentences.english: The hapless lieutenant let the Jedi Knight into the palace.
sentences.chinese: 這個倒黴的副手把那位絕地武士放進宮。

definition: to see, hear and obey (idiom); to take advice/to take sb at his word
to amuse oneself/to play with/to tease
imperial concubine or palace maid/imperial secretary (old)
to pass on a story/to communicate a message
